channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: DSNet: A Novel Way to Use Atrous Convolutions in Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Following these guidelines, we propose DSNet, a Dual-Branch CNN architecture, which incorporates atrous convolutions in the shallow layers of the model architecture, as well as pretraining the nearly entire encoder on ImageNet to achieve better performance.

item.title: LLMEmbed: Rethinking Lightweight LLM's Genuine Function in Text Classification
item.description: With the booming of Large Language Models (LLMs), prompt-learning has become a promising method mainly researched in various research areas.

item.title: VideoTetris: Towards Compositional Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: Diffusion models have demonstrated great success in text-to-video (T2V) generation.

item.title: VISTA: Visualized Text Embedding For Universal Multi-Modal Retrieval
item.description: Thirdly, we introduce a multi-stage training algorithm, which first aligns the visual token embedding with the text encoder using massive weakly labeled data, and then develops multi-modal representation capability using the generated composed image-text data.

item.title: The CLRS-Text Algorithmic Reasoning Language Benchmark
item.description: Three years ago, a similar issue was identified and rectified in the field of neural algorithmic reasoning, with the advent of the CLRS benchmark.

item.title: From Tissue Plane to Organ World: A Benchmark Dataset for Multimodal Biomedical Image Registration using Deep Co-Attention Networks
item.description: To gain the most information from this multimodal, multiscale approach, it is desirable to identify precisely where a histologic tissue section was taken from within the organ in order to correlate with the tissue features in exactly the same organ region.

item.title: ABEX: Data Augmentation for Low-Resource NLU via Expanding Abstract Descriptions
item.description: We present ABEX, a novel and effective generative data augmentation methodology for low-resource Natural Language Understanding (NLU) tasks.

item.title: MLVU: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Multi-Task Long Video Understanding
item.description: To address the above problems, we propose a new benchmark, called MLVU (Multi-task Long Video Understanding Benchmark), for the comprehensive and in-depth evaluation of LVU.

item.title: Offline Multi-Objective Optimization
item.description: Offline optimization aims to maximize a black-box objective function with a static dataset and has wide applications.

item.title: M3LEO: A Multi-Modal, Multi-Label Earth Observation Dataset Integrating Interferometric SAR and RGB Data
item.description: Satellite-based remote sensing has revolutionised the way we address global challenges in a rapidly evolving world.

item.title: Contrastive Sparse Autoencoders for Interpreting Planning of Chess-Playing Agents
item.description: This is unsustainable in ensuring transparency to the end-user, particularly when these systems are responsible for sensitive decision-making.

item.title: FairytaleQA Translated: Enabling Educational Question and Answer Generation in Less-Resourced Languages
item.description: By employing fine-tuned, modest-scale models, we establish benchmarks for both Question Generation (QG) and QA tasks within the translated datasets.

item.title: PaCE: Parsimonious Concept Engineering for Large Language Models
item.description: Alignment methods are designed to reduce such undesirable output, via techniques such as fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and representation engineering.

item.title: Low-Rank Similarity Mining for Multimodal Dataset Distillation
item.description: Though dataset distillation has witnessed rapid development in recent years, the distillation of multimodal data, e. g., image-text pairs, poses unique and under-explored challenges.

item.title: Legal Documents Drafting with Fine-Tuned Pre-Trained Large Language Model
item.description: However, in the legal field application, it is difficult to obtain a large number of manually annotated data sets, which restricts the typical method applied to the task of drafting legal documents.

item.title: LNQ Challenge 2023: Learning Mediastinal Lymph Node Segmentation with a Probabilistic Lymph Node Atlas
item.description: The evaluation of lymph node metastases plays a crucial role in achieving precise cancer staging, influencing subsequent decisions regarding treatment options.

item.title: Stereo-Depth Fusion through Virtual Pattern Projection
item.description: This paper presents a novel general-purpose stereo and depth data fusion paradigm that mimics the active stereo principle by replacing the unreliable physical pattern projector with a depth sensor.

item.title: Lean Workbook: A large-scale Lean problem set formalized from natural language math problems
item.description: Our results indicate that the synthetic data pipeline can provide useful training data and improve the performance of LLMs in translating and understanding complex mathematical problems and proofs.

item.title: HeSum: a Novel Dataset for Abstractive Text Summarization in Hebrew
item.description: While large language models (LLMs) excel in various natural language tasks in English, their performance in lower-resourced languages like Hebrew, especially for generative tasks such as abstractive summarization, remains unclear.

item.title: Data-Centric Label Smoothing for Explainable Glaucoma Screening from Eye Fundus Images
item.description: As current computing capabilities increase, modern machine learning and computer vision system tend to increase in complexity, mostly by means of larger models and advanced optimization strategies.

item.title: UltraMedical: Building Specialized Generalists in Biomedicine
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities across various domains and are moving towards more specialized areas.

item.title: Matching Anything by Segmenting Anything
item.description: The robust association of the same objects across video frames in complex scenes is crucial for many applications, especially Multiple Object Tracking (MOT).

item.title: VidMuse: A Simple Video-to-Music Generation Framework with Long-Short-Term Modeling
item.description: In this work, we systematically study music generation conditioned solely on the video.

item.title: Reflective Policy Optimization
item.description: On-policy reinforcement learning methods, like Trust Region Policy Optimization (TRPO) and Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO), often demand extensive data per update, leading to sample inefficiency.

item.title: ValueBench: Towards Comprehensively Evaluating Value Orientations and Understanding of Large Language Models
item.description: This work introduces ValueBench, the first comprehensive psychometric benchmark for evaluating value orientations and value understanding in LLMs.

item.title: Learning 1D Causal Visual Representation with De-focus Attention Networks
item.description: The issue of "over-focus" hinders the model's ability to extract diverse visual features and to receive effective gradients for optimization.

item.title: DICE: Detecting In-distribution Contamination in LLM's Fine-tuning Phase for Math Reasoning
item.description: The advancement of large language models (LLMs) relies on evaluation using public benchmarks, but data contamination can lead to overestimated performance.

item.title: Adaptive Multi-Scale Decomposition Framework for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Transformer-based and MLP-based methods have emerged as leading approaches in time series forecasting (TSF).

item.title: NoisyGL: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Graph Neural Networks under Label Noise
item.description: However, due to variations in dataset selection, data splitting, and preprocessing techniques, the community currently lacks a comprehensive benchmark, which impedes deeper understanding and further development of GLN.

item.title: Enhanced Semantic Segmentation Pipeline for WeatherProof Dataset Challenge
item.description: Firstly, we improve semantic segmentation models, using backbone pretrained with Depth Anything to improve UperNet model and SETRMLA model, and adding language guidance based on both weather and category information to InternImage model.

item.title: Parameter-Inverted Image Pyramid Networks
item.description: Our core idea is to use models with different parameter sizes to process different resolution levels of the image pyramid, thereby balancing computational efficiency and performance.

item.title: How Far Can We Compress Instant-NGP-Based NeRF?
item.description: In this paper, we introduce the Context-based NeRF Compression (CNC) framework, which leverages highly efficient context models to provide a storage-friendly NeRF representation.

item.title: Instance Segmentation and Teeth Classification in Panoramic X-rays
item.description: This article offers a pipeline of two deep learning models, U-Net and YOLOv8, which results in BB-UNet, a new architecture for the classification and segmentation of teeth on panoramic X-rays that is efficient and reliable.

item.title: Privacy Preserving Semi-Decentralized Mean Estimation over Intermittently-Connected Networks
item.description: We consider the problem of privately estimating the mean of vectors distributed across different nodes of an unreliable wireless network, where communications between nodes can fail intermittently.

item.title: DIRECT-3D: Learning Direct Text-to-3D Generation on Massive Noisy 3D Data
item.description: Unlike recent 3D generative models that rely on clean and well-aligned 3D data, limiting them to single or few-class generation, our model is directly trained on extensive noisy and unaligned `in-the-wild' 3D assets, mitigating the key challenge (i. e., data scarcity) in large-scale 3D generation.

item.title: Buffer of Thoughts: Thought-Augmented Reasoning with Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce Buffer of Thoughts (BoT), a novel and versatile thought-augmented reasoning approach for enhancing accuracy, efficiency and robustness of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: AgentGym: Evolving Large Language Model-based Agents across Diverse Environments
item.description: Building generalist agents that can handle diverse tasks and evolve themselves across different environments is a long-term goal in the AI community.

item.title: GLACE: Global Local Accelerated Coordinate Encoding
item.description: We propose GLACE, which integrates pre-trained global and local encodings and enables SCR to scale to large scenes with only a single small-sized network.

item.title: Vision-LSTM: xLSTM as Generic Vision Backbone
item.description: Transformers are widely used as generic backbones in computer vision, despite initially introduced for natural language processing.

item.title: EngineBench: Flow Reconstruction in the Transparent Combustion Chamber III Optical Engine
item.description: Here we propose a novel inpainting task using random edge gaps, a technique that emphasises realism by introducing occlusions at random sizes and orientations at the edges of the PIV images.

item.title: MultifacetEval: Multifaceted Evaluation to Probe LLMs in Mastering Medical Knowledge
item.description: In this paper, we aim to explore the causes of this gap by employing a multifaceted examination schema to systematically probe the actual mastery of medical knowledge by current LLMs.

item.title: Using Synchronic Definitions and Semantic Relations to Classify Semantic Change Types
item.description: There is abundant evidence of the fact that the way words change their meaning can be classified in different types of change, highlighting the relationship between the old and new meanings (among which generalization, specialization and co-hyponymy transfer).

item.title: Computation-Efficient Era: A Comprehensive Survey of State Space Models in Medical Image Analysis
item.description: State Space Models (SSMs), specifically the \textit{\textbf{Mamba}} model with selection mechanisms and hardware-aware architecture, have garnered immense interest lately in sequential modeling and visual representation learning, challenging the dominance of transformers by providing infinite context lengths and offering substantial efficiency maintaining linear complexity in the input sequence.

item.title: CommonPower: Supercharging Machine Learning for Smart Grids
item.description: Furthermore equipped with a generic forecasting interface, CommonPower constitutes a versatile tool significantly augmenting the exploration of safe RL controllers in smart grids on several dimensions.

item.title: PosterLLaVa: Constructing a Unified Multi-modal Layout Generator with LLM
item.description: Layout generation is the keystone in achieving automated graphic design, requiring arranging the position and size of various multi-modal design elements in a visually pleasing and constraint-following manner.

item.title: Second-order differential operators, stochastic differential equations and Brownian motions on embedded manifolds
item.description: We also propose the retractive Euler-Maruyama method to solve a SDE, taking into account the second-order term of a tangent retraction.

item.title: Tiny models from tiny data: Textual and null-text inversion for few-shot distillation
item.description: Using knowledge distillation, the capabilities of high-performing but slow models can be transferred to tiny, efficient models.

item.title: Error-preserving Automatic Speech Recognition of Young English Learners' Language
item.description: In this work, we build an ASR system that satisfies these requirements: it works on spontaneous speech by young language learners and preserves their errors.

item.title: QJL: 1-Bit Quantized JL Transform for KV Cache Quantization with Zero Overhead
item.description: However, traditional quantization methods face significant memory overhead due to the need to store quantization constants (at least a zero point and a scale) in full precision per data block.

item.title: Image Copy-Move Forgery Detection and Localization Scheme: How to Avoid Missed Detection and False Alarm
item.description: Image copy-move is an operation that replaces one part of the image with another part of the same image, which can be used for illegal purposes due to the potential semantic changes.
